Dialogue:
DM: Good evening.
BP: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
DM: Have you done any shopping recently?
BP: Yes, I recently bought a neck cooler. It's been very useful.
DM: What exactly is a neck cooler?
BP: It’s a device that you chill and wear around your neck to stay comfortable.
DM: Is it like a towel made from a special material?
BP: It’s made from a material used in space, and it has a coolant pack inside.
DM: That's fascinating. I'd love to try it.
BP: You can find one for about 1000 yen on Qoo10.
DM: That sounds affordable. Can it be used multiple times?
BP: Yes, it solidifies quickly in the refrigerator and is reusable.
DM: Does it warm up fast in hot environments?
BP: It stays cool for about 2 hours. For outdoor activities, a cooling towel or patch might be better.
DM: It might help lower electricity costs at home.
BP: Yes, it’s a good alternative to using the air conditioner for small tasks.
DM: I live alone, and my electricity bill has been high lately.
BP: Electricity prices have increased by about 1000 yen on average.
DM: Going out can be expensive too, right?
BP: Yes, but public places like libraries or shopping malls are good options.
DM: I went to a shopping mall today, and it was very crowded.
BP: And driving costs fuel. It’s easy to make unplanned purchases when you’re out.
DM: I often end up buying unnecessary items.
BP: That’s common for many people.
DM: I love reading and often buy books when I visit a bookstore.
BP: Libraries are a great way to borrow books instead of buying them.
DM: Libraries are convenient, but popular books are hard to borrow.
BP: You can reserve books, but it might take a while to get them.
DM: It feels like you want to read them right away.
BP: I understand. Thank you for the conversation today.

DM: Good evening.  
BP: Good evening.  
DM: Thank you in advance.  
BP: Did you have dinner?  
DM: Not yet, but I had a late lunch.  
BP: You must be hungry. Are you okay?  
DM: Yes, I'm holding up.  
BP: We received zucchini and made ratatouille.  
DM: Summer vegetables are wonderful!  
BP: They help with preventing fatigue and colds.  
DM: Seasonal vegetables taste great.  
BP: With a pressure cooker, ratatouille is quick.  
DM: Does it usually take long?  
BP: Yes, it needs simmering time.  
DM: Got it. I made corn rice recently.  
BP: Do you use a rice cooker?  
DM: Yes, with fresh corn.  
BP: I'll try that next time.  
DM: Add the core for extra flavor!  
BP: I thought just the kernels were used.  
DM: The broth from the core enhances the taste.  
BP: I'll try it. Thanks for the tip!  
DM: What other summer vegetables are there?  
BP: Tomatoes, eggplants, okra, and bitter melons.  
DM: I love tomatoes! How do you have them?  
BP: Fresh, and in dishes like ratatouille.  
DM: Fresh ones are better than canned.  
BP: Despite high prices, I still enjoy summer vegetables.  
DM: Let's avoid summer fatigue! Thanks!  
BP: Take care. Thank you!

DM: Good evening.
BP: Do you like movies?
DM: Yes, I watch movies on Amazon Prime.
BP: You don't visit movie theaters often?
DM: I like them but haven't had the chance. Last watched Aladdin, Frozen 2, and Kaguya-sama's finale.
BP: I also watched Aladdin. Romantic?
DM: Different from the anime but visually amazing.
BP: I go often because there's a nearby theater.
DM: Nice. Seeing Tang with Ninomiya-kun and a robot this summer.
BP: Exciting. Ninomiya-kun's acting is good?
DM: Correct. Looking forward to it.
BP: Favorite actor?
DM: Recently, Shun Oguri and Mikako Tabe.
BP: Both are great. Shun Oguri is cool.
DM: Correct. Saw life-sized photos at the Izu Taiga Drama Museum.
BP: What's the current Taiga drama about?
DM: Kamakura Shogunate. Oguri plays Yoshitoki.
BP: Informative?
DM: Yes, but I watch YouTube explanation videos too.
BP: Too many characters to follow?
DM: Correct. This one is about the Kamakura Shogunate and 13 retainers.
BP: YouTube is essential. Hard to keep up without notes.
DM: Correct. Recently watched movie in theaters you liked best?
BP: Hard to choose, but Kingdom 2 and Jurassic Park.
DM: Curious about Kingdom. Was it grand?
BP: Yes, great impact. A must-see in theaters.
DM: I watch action movies in theaters and other genres at home.
BP: Agreed. I'll take my leave for today.

DM: Hello  
CN: Hello  
DM: What time did you wake up today?  
CN: 8 o'clock.  
DM: You're an early riser!  
CN: I take a nap afterward.  
DM: I can't sleep at night if I take a nap.  
CN: What time did you get up today?  
DM: 10 o'clock.  
CN: Is it always around that time?  
DM: On weekdays, around 7 o'clock; on days off, I wake up late.  
CN: Holidays are definitely later.  
DM: The weather was bad today, so I didn't feel like getting up.  
CN: I woke up because it was garbage day.  
DM: It's the worst when you forget to take it out, right?  
CN: It was raining on the recyclable garbage day, so I couldn't put it out the night before.  
DM: You're responsible. Some people here just put out trash anytime.  
CN: I feel bad asking them to collect wet cardboard.  
DM: I also need to get rid of the accumulating cardboard.  
CN: Cardboard tends to accumulate.  
DM: I put it off until it accumulates, then tie it up and dispose of it.  
CN: It accumulates while you're doing that.  
DM: I like tying up cardboard boxes.  
CN: I can't put things together nicely.  
DM: It feels good to tie it well because it's difficult.  
CN: Any tips on how to do it well?  
DM: Tighten it firmly and frequently.  
CN: I'll try it next time.  
DM: Thanks for talking with me today!  
CN: Thank you!

DM: Hello  
CN: Hello  
DM: What do you do on your days off?  
CN: Read and do housework.  
DM: You read books.  
CN: Yes, but not many.  
DM: 1-2 books a month?  
CN: Yes.  
DM: I find reading difficult.  
CN: It takes effort.  
DM: Long periods or short sessions?  
CN: Short sessions for business books.  
DM: Depends on the genre?  
CN: Novels are read all at once.  
DM: Engaging stories are absorbing.  
CN: Not knowing the ending is troubling.  
DM: Hard to keep track of characters.  
CN: Easy to forget.  
DM: I watch Netflix on holidays.  
CN: Movies or series?  
DM: Movies and anime.  
CN: Anything interesting lately?  
DM: A soccer anime, "Aoashi."  
CN: Interesting.  
DM: It's a great boys' manga.  
CN: Intense.  
DM: You should check it out.  
CN: I will.

DM: Good evening.
HJ: Good evening.
DM: It's been cool recently.
HJ: Yes, but it's a bit warm today.
DM: It feels warm during the day.
HJ: Yes, we still need the fan.
DM: Did you use a fan all summer?
HJ: I also used the air conditioner.
DM: I used an air conditioner and a circulator.
HJ: What is a circulator?
DM: Using both can reduce electricity bills.
HJ: How effective was it?
DM: It saved about 1000 yen.
HJ: Was the circulator expensive?
DM: It cost about 3,000 yen.
HJ: Affordable. Was it worth it?
DM: The air conditioning seemed more efficient.
HJ: Is your room big?
DM: It's about 9 tatami mats.
HJ: It still made a difference?
DM: Yes, I didn't always need the air conditioner.
HJ: Better to leave it on for short outings?
DM: Yes, people say that.
HJ: I haven't checked this summer's electricity bill.
DM: That can be worrying.
HJ: Yes, I've used the air conditioner a lot.
DM: Without it, it's hard to stay comfortable.
HJ: Absolutely. I always had it on.
DM: I relied on it completely.
HJ: Yes.

DM: Hello!  
HJ: Hello.  
DM: It's already October, but do you have any memories from this summer?  
HJ: I went on a trip.  
DM: Oh! That's nice! Where to?  
HJ: Shikoku and Ishikawa area, for example.  
DM: I'm jealous! I've never been there.  
HJ: Is that so! You don't travel much?  
DM: I enjoy traveling, but it's often to nearby places.  
HJ: I see. Did you go anywhere this summer?  
DM: I went to Atami!  
HJ: Sounds good! Is it the sea?  
DM: Yes! To the sea and to eat delicious food!  
HJ: Does Atami have any local specialties?  
DM: I bought things like salted fish and dried fish for my friend.  
HJ: I see. That sounds pretty good. It seems like it would make a good snack to go with alcohol.  
DM: Definitely. I drank quite a bit while I was there.  
HJ: Hahaha. Did you go to a bar?  
DM: Yes. I went to a place like a seafood bar.  
HJ: That's the place! It seems like there are a lot of young people.  
DM: That's right. There were many. The seafood bowl was exceptionally delicious.  
HJ: That's right. A seafood bowl sounds good.  
DM: And I drank highballs to the point of being drenched.  
HJ: Oh! Do you like highballs?  
DM: I like them! But I can't drink them straight.  
HJ: I like them too. I enjoy things like coke highballs.  
DM: Absolutely! It's great! The person who thought of that is really smart.  
HJ: No doubt about it! It's easy to drink, isn't it?  
DM: I tend to drink too much.  
HJ: I understand.

DM: Hello!  
HJ: Hello.  
DM: How do you spend your days off?  
HJ: I usually go to the hot springs.  
DM: Is it close by?  
HJ: Yes, there's a big one nearby.  
DM: That sounds wonderful!  
HJ: There's even a waterfall there.  
DM: Wow, that's really impressive!  
HJ: Plus, there are many saunas as well.  
DM: Does it get busy often?  
HJ: Yes, especially on holidays.  
DM: I see. I often go to public baths too.  
HJ: Are they close to you?  
DM: Yes, about 1 kilometer away.  
HJ: That sounds convenient! Do you enjoy the saunas?  
DM: Actually, I’ve recently gotten into them.  
HJ: They have become quite popular lately.  
DM: Indeed, it's always crowded.  
HJ: Saunas tend to be that way.  
DM: Is it safe during the COVID-19 pandemic?  
HJ: The risk remains since it's the same bath.  
DM: It's surprising there haven't been any clusters. Do you visit the sauna often?  
HJ: Not for long periods.  
DM: My limit is 10 minutes.  
HJ: That's impressive! I can only last about 5 minutes.  
DM: Perhaps the temperature is lower where I go. Is your metabolism good?  
HJ: Possibly, but I get dizzy quickly.  
DM: A friend of mine collapsed from overexertion, so please be careful.  
HJ: That's concerning. I’ll make sure to take care.
